intro: Clarkia virgata subsp. australis, commonly known as the southern Clarkia, is a flowering plant native to western North America. It belongs to the evening primrose family (Onagraceae) and is characterized by its showy, pink or red flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. Clarkia virgata subsp. australis is valued for its ornamental beauty and is often cultivated in gardens.
